page.title: 14Avebury Manor House
page.content: Dating from before the Conquest (Avebury Manor was built on the site of a Benedictine Cell) and standing beside the Great Stone Circle of Avebury, this early Elizabethan Manor house having been carefully restored, is now a family home. Oak panelled rooms and coved plasterwork ceilings, state rooms visited by Queen Anne and Charles 11. Much early oak and fine furniture in period setting. Portraits dating from 1532 (many by courtesy of the Marquess and Marchioness of Ailesbury). The Queen Anne bedroom with imposing state bed and Mary Tudor travelling chest.
